ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I believe I am powerless over my alcoholism and/or drug addiction.
I believe in a power greater than myself.
I live as if I have turned my will and life over to the care of a Higher Power.
I am open and ready to have my Higher Power remove my defects of character.
I ask my Higher Power to remove my shortcomings.
I pray and meditate daily to improve my connection to my Higher Power.
I believe that I will progress in recovery with the help of my Higher Power.
I base my decisions in life on what will serve to deepen and preserve my inner ''serenity'' or peace.
When I realize I'm wrong, I promptly admit it.
I am honest with myself and others.
I attempt to help others even when it is inconvenient for me to do so.
I attempt to forgive others when they offend or hurt me.
I treat other people as I would like to be treated.
I resist the temptation to possess, control, or manipulate others.
I make amends to those I have harmed.
I perform a daily self-evaluation.
I perform frequent ''spot check inventories'' during the day and night.
I practice the Twelve Steps in all of my affairs.
I am aware of what I need to change or work on for my ongoing recovery.
I share and discuss my blocks to recovery with others.
I express my feelings, talking honestly about my experiences with others.
The 12 Step Affiliation and Practices Scale (TSAPS) Total Score
